posts.author: Lathandier
posts.content:
Heya,

I'm looking to build a Tyr Paladin - one of the Triad. I will be playing this build on Arelith, and do have a rather heavy RP focus. My downfall tends to be I don't care about builds, but it does sometimes come to crunch when you do need to lay the smackdown in pvp - and I'd at least like to be competitive since everyone else is.

Paladins on Arelith gain a hard bonus to Wisdom every 7 levels after 1 so at level 21 for e.g. you'd gain a hard +3 wis. At 21 you also gain a +3 CL to dispels. Other than that there are no real changes to Pallys. Fighter's have a tonne of additions to make them more viable as straight builds on Arelith, so I was thinking something that could get up in the face of someone and go "Hyah!" and bam bam bam!

But really, I'm just a bit stuck for inspiration. A strength based pally seems the way to go, but I really don't know as I haven't much experience.

Any help would be fantastic.

Kindest regards,

Lathy

posts.author: Freaky Grandma
posts.content:
Hello Lathy,

welcome to the treasure trove of builds!
I don't know a thing about Arelith, and I'm still not much of a builder, but others here probably will be able to help you. Have you checked the game guides section yet? There is a helpful post from Maximilian Kane about the Paladin class.
While the builds are for WOG and go to level 40, you still might want to check here: http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... index.html. Maybe there is something that is close to what you have in mind?
I also would recommend downloading the ECB guild filter: https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... ild-filter.

Do you want a single class paladin or some class combination? The more specific you are in your request, the better the experts here can help you.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Lathy, good to meet you.

FG makes some good suggestions. I'm not a pally player myself (keep meaning to, but so many builds, so little time), but just wondering, are you wanting to boost Charisma and Strength, or just the one? Pally/CoT always seems like a strong build - particularly if Cha-based (with 10 CoT levels), while Pally/Fighter might make more sense if you're just looking for Str (with 6 Fighter levels). You've probably got enough room for a 3rd class - one that could give Tumble, for example - so Rogue or Bard might be good options (just for 4 levels), or even Monk.

Just trying to keep you thinking until someone who knows what they're talking about comes along!

Cheers

posts.author: Lathandier
posts.content:
Hey guys! Thanks for the responses!

I am a fan (despite them generally being weaker) of straight builds. So 30 pally. I just don't know how viable that is, so was also thinking of throwing Fighter in there for extra feats. I'm not a fan of cookie cutter (although it looks like there are very few cookie cutter builds for paladins) - as the roleplay and unique/gimmick aspect for me tends to win me over. (e.g. I have a straight Barbarian on Arelith, all CON and DR) EDIT: So a high CHA seems like something stereotypically a Pally would have if they dedicated their life to it - but also STR in there too. Who knows?

I'll take a look at the recommended builds from Max. I've read a lot of Max's builds and I like what he has to say.

Thanks for your welcoming words guys!

EDIT AGAIN: Okay - so I've decided on their base race as Dwarf. On Arelith Dwarves get the Dwarven Waraxe proficiency automatically - so Dwarven Waraxe + Tower Shield. Maybe even a Dwarven Defender/Pally combo???? Is that INSANE?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Well, again I reinforce that I haven' played a pally, but I did wonder about DwD/Pally. I veered away in fear of mockery from the great and good - though that's never bothered me much before. I suppose it's about the number of feats required to have both classes work well - plus the challenge of having 3 big stats (Str, Con, and Cha) in only 30 levels (especially given the negative to Cha for Dwarves), and at least 1 other having to be better than adequate (Wis). And a decent Dex is needed to meet DwD requirements. It may be possible, but it would take someone better than I am to come up with it - sorry.

Cheers

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Str(14) Dex(13) Con(12) Int(13) Wis(14) Cha(12) - (after dwarf's racial adjustments) could work, but you would be massively underpowered. These concepts are better left for single-player modules where the competition is less fierce. If it is your first time(s) playing in an unknown environment then you better start with something that is proven/strong and you can come up with ideas for role-playing her later, or you could let the character grow by itself and tell her own stories.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: Wis would not have to be higher than 11 or 12 to begin with if you plan on taking 14 or 21 Paladin levels.
